lines.text: [Uttering a line harkening back to Phyllis and Bob's previous movie together]
Boy, have YOU got a wrong number.

[finding $10,000]
Poor guy who lost this doesn't get it back, he'll empty his swimming pool and dive in.
Honey, we're talking about $10.000. Nobody can afford to lose that kind of money unless they have long hair and play a guitar.
[Henry answers the front door while holding his engagement ring for Ellie]
Oh, Henry, you shouldn't have!
I didn't.
I know, but I love to watch a coward squirm.
Hey, Marty! What are you doin' here at this hour? Your wife left you.
Nothing like that. This is BAD news.

[treed to the top of the refrigerator by the family dog]
I wanted THIS kind of action, I'd have been a mailman.
But I want to be with you.
Yeah, but they wouldn't put me in a women's prison.

[driving]
Hey, I'll cut over and go up the on-ramp.
The freeway? Won't it be easy to recognize us?
Not up there. Everybody drives like a fugitive.

[to Golda]
Listen, I don't mind you having a little snack, but with your appetite I have to keep counting the kids around here.

[after scaring his dad with a toy gun]
Ha-ha-ha. I scared him.
Don't ever do that, Mark. Daddy could die of fright.
If he does, can I have his room?
Boy, I've got to get you out of here. You're breathing too much of this detergent.
You know, there's something sick about being so honest.
You think I'm happy about it? But I gotta think about the kids. I got to set an example for 'em to follow.
Some example! They'll grow up and try to become idiots.
Well, hello, Honey. Hey, how about puttin' down your pencil and putting on some lipstick? I'm taking you out to dinner tonight to someplace special where you don't have to order the special.

[trying to show off her new dress while her siblings are busily enjoying their own new things]
Well, with this family I might as well walk around naked.

[sing-songy]
Ah, you said a dirty word.
Hey, if money can't buy happiness, then this is a pretty crazy brand of misery.
But, Marty, you believe me, don't ya?
Of course. You're not bright enough to steal fifty thousand dollars.
FIFTY thousand dollars?

[to himself]
All I have to do now is figure out what I have to do now.

[butting in]
Get out of town.
Hey, how do you know what happened?
I've got wall-to-wall ears.
Hey, you're very kind.
You're very playful.

[as Golda gyrates around the kitchen]
Hey, what're you doing?
I'm dancing. Oh, that music turns me on!
Really? I thought you had a cold button somewhere.

[thinking Golda has been sneaking around with his boss]
How long has this been going on?
About thirty seconds. I knew you'd find out, sooner or later.

[at police headquarters]
What kind of a third degree is THIS? Here I was, looking forward to something, and what do I get? No light in my eyes. All the water I want. No rubber hose. You haven't even hit me with a folded newspaper. Talk about police brutality!
Lieutenant, we'll never get her to talk if she won't stop talking.
This house is a bargain for a family like ours. It's cheaper than bail. And, besides, we gotta figure a place to hide out until I can get my name cleared, if you can clear "mud."
That "other guy" happens to be my sweetheart.
Boy! This guy is tough and slippery!
But is he REALLY happy?
Where you going?
Back to my wife. I can't stand her but at least she's loyal.
Hm! You just can't trust a married man.
